workflow.name: Hackathon - Threat Detected Events to Incidents + Investigate
workflow.title: Hackathon - Threat Detected Events to Incidents + Investigate

properties.name: SecureX Environment URL
properties.description: Placeholder for the URL of the SecureX environment being used. You don't need to provide this, it will be fetched automatically

properties.name: Secure Endpoint Environment URL
properties.description: Placeholder for the URL of the Secure Endpoint environment being used. You don't need to provide this, it will be fetched automatically

This workflow periodically checks a Secure Endpoint instance for Threat Detected events. When an event is returned, the workflow collects information from it and creates a casebook and incident in Threat Response to document what happened. This workflow is designed to run every 5 minutes on a schedule.

Target Group: Default TargetGroup

Targets: AMP_Target, CTR_For_Access_Token, Private_CTIA_Target

Steps:
[] Detect the region/environment being used
[] Calculate date/times
[] Fetch events from Secure Endpoint
[] Check if events were returned, if not end the workflow
[] For each event:
[]> Extract the event's information
[]> Format the information for Threat Response
[]> Create an incident, casebook, and sighting

More information: https://ciscosecurity.github.io/sxo-05-security-workflows/workflows/0026

workflow.title: Move Computer to AMP Triage Group

properties.name: Triage Group Name
properties.description: Name of the group to move computers to

[Move Computer to AMP Triage Group]
[Supported observables: IP address, hostname, AMP GUID]

Workflow Description:
When triggered, this workflow will move the endpoint identified by the provided observable to an AMP triage device group.

Workflow Requirements:
This workflow requires the Triage Group Name local variable to be populated and valid AMP API credentials in the AMP_Credentials account key. Please verify these settings prior to execution.
